Experiment Method.Assay Method: Cell viability assay with H2O2 exposure

Material used.Description: Human embryonic kidney cells (HEK293) and human neuroblastoma cells (SH-SY5Y) were used.

Readout description.Result Description: Reduced stress tolerance and ERK pathway activation compared to wild-type.
Reduced stress tolerance and ERK pathway activation compared to wild-type.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed for each condition.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector or vehicle was used as a negative control.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Normal stress tolerance and ERK pathway activation levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Reduced stress tolerance and ERK pathway activation levels below normal thresholds.

Approved assay.Description: This method is commonly used in Parkinson's disease research to assess cellular responses to oxidative stress.
